title: pH of 4 acids - which acid is HCl

content.description:
Refer to the following.

The pH of solutions of four acids prepared at various concentrations were measured and recorded in the table above.

The four acids are, in no particular order, chlorous, hydrochloric, lactic, and propanoic.
content.question: Which of the four acids listed in the table is hydrochloric acid?

topic.text: 8.2: pH and pOH of Strong Acids and Bases

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
